pageContext.description: Made of two overlapping halves soldered or fused together, & pierced on each side with a hole, which has an everted lip.
pageContext.associations: Found with 6 other balls of similar type, Nos. 483, 480, 481, 479, 478, 482. (Frontispiece)
pageContext.publications: Petrie, Dublin Penny Journal, iii, p.144.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin, Frontispiece 477, W. 28., purchased from Messrs. West.
pageContext.site: Ireland, Co. Leitrim, Carrick-on-Shannon (found in a potato field near)
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
